content.description: Just right of Gland Entry, you'll notice a series of "overlaps" up a wall that is much taller and steeper than it looks from below. The overlaps get farther apart, and the crux comes right at a bolt with a full dyno to a hidden jug. The crack finish links into the Gland Entry sling anchor.
content.location: Just right of Gland Entry (left side). Look for the obvious overlaps

content.description: I think I can safely call this a sport route with 8 bolts spaced generously. Either run-out the 5.9 climbing at the top or sling a horn to feel more comfortable. Fun bouldery movement on crimps, slopers, pinches and whatever else you can find.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 1 sling for the top before the anchors.
content.location: The route furthest into the gully on the left wall. Look for the obvious line of bolts.

content.description: Next route to the right of Stellar, just past a blank overhanging wall. The guide shows three bolts, but I could not find the third, even on rappel. Bring gear from micro-nuts up to #2. Save a #2 for after the second bolt! 10-12' above the second bolt, I cut left and took the path of least resistance way out left. Run it out 30' on mellow terrain to a sling anchor. I would give it three stars if that third bolt existed, allowing you to continue up the steeper part of the wall, rather than cutting left.
content.location: 30' right of Stellar. Look for a bolt 12' up and on a small section of less than vertical rock.

content.description: Fantastic route! The first thing you'll probably notice is: 90 feet, three bolts and two slung horns. If you follow the correct sequences, it doesn't feel run out. Solid, incut edges most of the way up the climb and fun sequences.
content.protection: Three bolts and two slung horns
content.location: slightly right of center on the East Wall

content.description: Great climb with fun face climbing separated by roof. The cruxes vary, but there are bolts right where you seem to need them.
content.protection: 5 bolts and gear. I used a 0.4, and 0.3 in the crack after the first bolt and didn't need any gear after that. You may want to bring extra to feel comfortable.
content.location: On the right wall at the top of the gully. Look for the low bolt directly across from hanuman. Recommend stick clip for first bolt if not comfortable on 5.10. Hit the first bolt, follow the finger crack, then veer slightly right to the bolts under the roof, follow those to the top.
